faq.webDev1Q: How long does it take to build a website?
faq.webDev1A: A single-page site takes 3-5 business days. A multi-page site with 5-7 pages takes 7-10 days. Complex projects with multilingual support take 14-18 days. We always deliver on time.
faq.webDev2Q: What technologies do you use for web development?
faq.webDev2A: We use React 18, Next.js 14, Vite, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS. For animations, we use Framer Motion. Every site is built with performance and SEO as core priorities.
faq.webDev3A: Yes, every website we build is fully responsive. We test on mobile, tablet, and desktop to ensure a perfect experience on all devices. Mobile-first design is our standard approach.
faq.webDev4Q: What is included in the 30 days of free support?
faq.webDev4A: Bug fixes, minor content updates, and technical support via email. For ongoing maintenance including hosting, security updates, and monthly reports, see our Care Plan at €97/month.
faq.ecommerce1Q: Which payment providers do you integrate?
faq.ecommerce1A: We integrate Stripe (for card payments across Europe), LemonSqueezy (for digital products), and can add local payment methods like iDEAL (Netherlands), Bancontact (Belgium), or Klarna.
faq.ecommerce2Q: Can you build a multilingual online store?
faq.ecommerce2A: Absolutely. We build stores with full multilingual support including localized product descriptions, multi-currency pricing, and region-specific shipping and tax calculations.
faq.ecommerce3Q: How do you handle inventory management?
faq.ecommerce3A: We build custom inventory systems with real-time stock tracking, low-stock alerts, and automatic status updates. For complex needs, we integrate with existing ERP or warehouse systems.
faq.ecommerce4Q: What about GDPR compliance for e-commerce?
faq.ecommerce4A: All our e-commerce sites include GDPR-compliant cookie consent, privacy policies, data processing agreements, and secure customer data handling. We follow EU data protection regulations.
faq.seo1Q: How quickly will I see SEO results?
faq.seo1A: Technical fixes show impact within 2-4 weeks. Content and keyword optimizations typically take 2-3 months to show ranking improvements. SEO is a long-term investment with compounding returns.
faq.seo2Q: Do you guarantee first page rankings?
faq.seo2A: No ethical SEO agency can guarantee specific rankings. What we guarantee is measurable improvement in your organic visibility, traffic quality, and technical performance scores.
faq.seo3Q: What is included in the monthly SEO report?
faq.seo3A: Rankings for target keywords, organic traffic trends, Core Web Vitals scores, crawl errors, backlink profile, competitor movements, and actionable recommendations for the next month.
faq.seo4A: Yes. We implement proper hreflang tags, create localized keyword strategies, and optimize content for each language market. Each language version gets its own SEO attention.
faq.marketing1Q: What is your minimum ad budget recommendation?
faq.marketing1A: For Google Ads, we recommend a minimum of €500/month per market. This gives enough data for optimization. Our management fee starts at €247/month on top of ad spend.
faq.marketing2Q: Which social media platforms do you manage?
faq.marketing2A: We focus on LinkedIn for B2B, Instagram for visual brands, and Facebook for local businesses. We recommend choosing 2-3 platforms rather than spreading too thin.
faq.marketing3Q: How do you measure marketing ROI?
faq.marketing3A: We set up conversion tracking from day one. Every lead, sale, and phone call is attributed to its source. Monthly reports show cost per acquisition, return on ad spend, and growth trends.
faq.marketing4Q: Can you create content in multiple languages?
faq.marketing4A: Yes. We create marketing content in English, French, Dutch, and German. Each market gets culturally adapted messaging, not just direct translations.
faq.reactDev1Q: Why choose React over other frontend frameworks?
faq.reactDev1A: React offers the largest ecosystem, most available developers, and best long-term support. Companies like Meta, Airbnb, and Netflix use React. It ensures your project can be maintained and extended by any skilled developer.
faq.reactDev2Q: Can you migrate our existing website to React?
faq.reactDev2A: Yes. We migrate from WordPress, jQuery, Angular, and Vue to React using an incremental approach. Your SEO rankings are preserved with proper redirects and metadata migration throughout the process.
faq.reactDev3Q: Do you use React with server-side rendering?
faq.reactDev3A: For SEO-critical projects, we use Next.js which adds server-side rendering to React. For internal apps and dashboards, client-side React with Vite provides faster development cycles.
faq.reactDev4Q: What is included in your React project deliverables?
faq.reactDev4A: Full source code with TypeScript, component documentation in Storybook, unit and integration tests, CI/CD pipeline, deployment setup, and 30 days of post-launch support.
faq.nextjsDev1Q: When should I choose Next.js over plain React?
faq.nextjsDev1A: Choose Next.js when SEO is critical, such as marketing websites, blogs, and e-commerce. Next.js server-side rendering ensures search engines index your content immediately, unlike client-side React.
faq.nextjsDev2Q: Do you deploy Next.js on Vercel?
faq.nextjsDev2A: Vercel is our recommended platform for Next.js deployments. However, we also deploy to other providers including Netlify, AWS, and custom servers depending on your requirements.
faq.nextjsDev3A: Absolutely. Next.js has built-in internationalisation with locale-based routing. We implement middleware for automatic language detection, hreflang tags, and localised URLs for each market.
faq.nextjsDev4Q: What is the App Router and should we use it?
faq.nextjsDev4A: The App Router is Next.js 14's recommended architecture. It enables server components, nested layouts, and streaming SSR. We use it for all new projects as it provides better performance and developer experience.
faq.typescriptDev1Q: Is TypeScript worth the extra development time?
faq.typescriptDev1A: TypeScript adds minimal time upfront but saves significantly in maintenance. Studies show TypeScript prevents 15% of bugs that reach production. For long-lived projects, the investment pays back within months.
faq.typescriptDev2Q: Can you add TypeScript to our existing JavaScript project?
faq.typescriptDev2A: Yes. We migrate JavaScript projects to TypeScript incrementally, file by file. Your application continues working throughout the migration. We typically complete migrations within two to four weeks.
faq.typescriptDev3Q: Do you use TypeScript on both frontend and backend?
faq.typescriptDev3A: Yes. We use TypeScript across the full stack including React frontends, Node.js APIs, and Supabase Edge Functions. Shared type definitions between frontend and backend eliminate integration bugs.
faq.typescriptDev4Q: What TypeScript version and configuration do you use?
faq.typescriptDev4A: We use the latest stable TypeScript with strict mode enabled. Our configuration includes noUncheckedIndexedAccess, exactOptionalPropertyTypes, and strict null checks for maximum type safety.
faq.frontendDev1Q: What frontend technologies do you specialise in?
faq.frontendDev1A: React with TypeScript is our primary stack, styled with Tailwind CSS and animated with Framer Motion. We also work with Next.js for server-rendered applications and Vite for fast development builds.
faq.frontendDev2Q: How do you ensure cross-browser compatibility?
faq.frontendDev2A: We test on Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge on both desktop and mobile. We use progressive enhancement to ensure core functionality works everywhere while modern browsers get enhanced features.
faq.frontendDev3A: Accessibility is built into every component we create. We follow WCAG 2.1 AA standards with keyboard navigation, screen reader support, proper ARIA attributes, and sufficient colour contrast throughout.
faq.frontendDev4Q: Can you work with our existing design system?
faq.frontendDev4A: Yes. We integrate with existing design systems in Figma, Storybook, or component libraries. If you need a design system built from scratch, we create one using Tailwind CSS and Radix UI primitives.
faq.pwa1Q: What is the difference between a PWA and a native app?
faq.pwa1A: PWAs are built with web technologies and accessed through a browser. They do not require app store approval, work across all platforms, and cost 50 to 70 percent less to develop than native apps while offering similar features.
faq.pwa2Q: Do PWAs work on iOS and Android?
faq.pwa2A: Yes. PWAs work on both platforms. Android provides full PWA support including installation prompts and push notifications. iOS supports PWAs with some limitations around push notifications and background sync.
faq.pwa3Q: Can users install a PWA on their home screen?
faq.pwa3A: Yes. Users can add your PWA to their home screen with one tap. It launches in full-screen mode with your brand icon and splash screen, looking identical to a native app. No app store required.
faq.pwa4A: Yes. Service workers cache critical assets and content for offline access. Users can browse cached content, fill out forms, and interact with the app without internet. Data syncs when connectivity returns.
faq.apiDev1Q: What API architecture do you recommend?
faq.apiDev1A: For most projects, we recommend Supabase auto-generated REST APIs extended with Edge Functions for custom logic. For complex requirements, we build custom APIs with Node.js following RESTful design principles.
faq.apiDev2A: APIs are secured with JWT authentication, refresh token rotation, rate limiting, request validation with Zod, and row-level security in the database. We follow OWASP API security best practices.
faq.apiDev3A: Every API comes with auto-generated OpenAPI documentation including endpoint descriptions, request and response schemas, authentication guides, and interactive testing through Swagger UI.
faq.apiDev4Q: Can you build a GraphQL API?
faq.apiDev4A: Yes. Supabase provides auto-generated GraphQL APIs. For custom GraphQL needs, we build with Apollo Server or Pothos. GraphQL is ideal for frontend applications that need flexible data fetching.
faq.legacyMod1Q: Which legacy platforms can you migrate from?
faq.legacyMod1A: We migrate from WordPress, Drupal, Joomla, custom PHP, jQuery-based sites, Angular 1.x, and other outdated platforms to modern React and Next.js architectures with full SEO preservation.
faq.legacyMod2Q: Will we have downtime during the migration?
faq.legacyMod2A: No. We use an incremental migration approach where old and new systems run in parallel. The cutover happens instantly with DNS changes, and we can roll back within minutes if any issues arise.
faq.legacyMod3Q: How do you preserve our SEO during migration?
faq.legacyMod3A: We create comprehensive redirect maps for every URL, migrate all metadata and structured data, and monitor Google Search Console throughout the process. Most clients see SEO improvements after migration.
faq.legacyMod4Q: What cost savings can we expect after modernisation?
faq.legacyMod4A: Clients typically see 40 to 60 percent reduction in maintenance costs within the first year. Modern codebases require fewer patches, have better developer tooling, and new features ship faster.
faq.headlessCms1Q: What is a headless CMS and why should I use one?
faq.headlessCms1A: A headless CMS separates content management from the website frontend. Your team edits content in a familiar interface while the website runs on modern, fast technology. You get both editorial flexibility and top performance.
faq.headlessCms2Q: Which headless CMS do you recommend?
faq.headlessCms2A: Payload CMS is our top recommendation. It is TypeScript-based, self-hosted for EU data sovereignty, and infinitely customisable. We also work with Strapi and Sanity depending on project requirements.
faq.headlessCms3Q: Can editors preview content before publishing?
faq.headlessCms3A: Yes. We implement live preview functionality so editors see exactly how their content will appear on the website before clicking publish. Changes are visible in real time as they edit.
faq.headlessCms4Q: Does a headless CMS support multiple languages?
faq.headlessCms4A: Absolutely. Multilingual content management is built into every headless CMS setup. Editors manage content in all languages from a single interface with proper locale fallbacks and translation workflows.
faq.perfOpt1Q: What Lighthouse score improvement can I expect?
faq.perfOpt1A: We guarantee 95+ Lighthouse scores after optimisation. Websites starting at 30 to 50 typically reach 95 or above. The exact improvement depends on your starting point and technology stack.
faq.perfOpt2Q: How long does performance optimisation take?
faq.perfOpt2A: A typical optimisation project takes two to four weeks. We start with the highest-impact changes like image optimisation and code splitting, delivering measurable improvements within the first week.
faq.perfOpt3Q: Will performance optimisation affect our website's functionality?
faq.perfOpt3A: No. All optimisations are tested to ensure functionality remains identical. We focus on how assets are loaded and delivered, not on changing what your website does.
faq.perfOpt4Q: Do you optimise for mobile performance specifically?
faq.perfOpt4A: Yes. Mobile performance receives special attention since Google uses mobile-first indexing. We test on real mobile devices and 4G network conditions to ensure fast loading for all users.
faq.a11y1Q: Is web accessibility legally required in Europe?
faq.a11y1A: Yes. The European Accessibility Act requires digital services to be accessible by June 2025. Non-compliance can result in fines and legal action. Our audits ensure your website meets WCAG 2.1 AA standards.
faq.a11y2Q: What does WCAG 2.1 AA compliance involve?
faq.a11y2A: WCAG 2.1 AA covers perceivable, operable, understandable, and robust content. This includes text alternatives for images, keyboard navigation, colour contrast, form labels, and screen reader compatibility.
faq.a11y3Q: How do you test for accessibility?
faq.a11y3A: We combine automated testing with axe-core and Lighthouse with manual testing using keyboard navigation, screen readers like NVDA and VoiceOver, and colour contrast analysis across all pages.
faq.a11y4Q: Can you make an existing website accessible?
faq.a11y4A: Yes. We audit existing websites, create a prioritised remediation plan, and implement fixes. Most accessibility improvements can be made without redesigning the website, just improving the underlying code.
faq.integrations1Q: Which CRM platforms do you integrate with?
faq.integrations1A: We integrate with Salesforce, HubSpot, Pipedrive, Zoho, and Monday.com. Form submissions, lead scoring, and website behaviour data flow automatically into your CRM for efficient follow-up.
faq.integrations2A: Every integration includes error handling, retry logic, and monitoring. Webhook signatures are verified for security, and idempotency keys prevent duplicate processing. Health dashboards show real-time status.
faq.integrations3Q: Can you connect our website to accounting software?
faq.integrations3A: Yes. We integrate with Xero, QuickBooks, and other accounting platforms. Payment events, invoices, and subscription data can flow automatically to your accounting system, reducing manual data entry.
faq.integrations4Q: How long does an integration project take?
faq.integrations4A: Simple integrations like CRM form submission take one to two weeks. Complex multi-system integrations with bidirectional sync take four to eight weeks depending on the systems involved.
faq.shopifyDev1Q: Why choose Shopify over custom e-commerce?
faq.shopifyDev1A: Shopify handles hosting, security, PCI compliance, and payment processing out of the box. For most retail businesses, this reduces costs and launch time significantly compared to custom builds.
faq.shopifyDev2Q: Can you create a custom Shopify theme?
faq.shopifyDev2A: Yes. We build custom Shopify themes from scratch using Liquid, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Your store gets a unique design that reflects your brand rather than looking like every other Shopify store.
faq.shopifyDev3Q: Does Shopify support multi-currency for European selling?
faq.shopifyDev3A: Yes. Shopify Markets handles multi-currency pricing, localised checkout, and regional payment methods. We configure EUR, GBP, and CHF with market-specific pricing strategies for each country.
faq.shopifyDev4Q: Can you migrate our store to Shopify?
faq.shopifyDev4A: Yes. We migrate from WooCommerce, Magento, PrestaShop, and other platforms to Shopify. Products, customers, orders, and SEO data are transferred with proper redirects to preserve search rankings.
faq.multiCurrency1Q: How do you handle currency conversion?
faq.multiCurrency1A: We implement strategic per-market pricing rather than simple conversion. You set prices that feel natural in each currency. Automatic conversion with live exchange rates is available for products without manual pricing.
faq.multiCurrency2A: We support EUR, GBP, CHF, and any other currency your markets require. Each currency gets its own pricing strategy, rounding rules, and tax configuration.
faq.multiCurrency3Q: How is tax handled across different countries?
faq.multiCurrency3A: VAT is calculated automatically based on customer location. EU VAT rates, UK VAT, Swiss VAT, and B2B reverse charge mechanisms are all handled. Tax details appear correctly on invoices per jurisdiction.
faq.multiCurrency4Q: Can customers choose their preferred currency?
faq.multiCurrency4A: Yes. Geo-detection sets the default currency based on location, but customers can manually switch. Their preference is saved for future visits across devices.
faq.technicalSeo1Q: What does a technical SEO audit cover?
faq.technicalSeo1A: Our audit covers site speed, Core Web Vitals, crawlability, indexation, structured data, internal linking, mobile usability, and security. We produce a prioritised action plan with estimated impact for each fix.
faq.technicalSeo2Q: How do Core Web Vitals affect rankings?
faq.technicalSeo2A: Core Web Vitals are a confirmed Google ranking factor. Pages that pass LCP, INP, and CLS thresholds receive a ranking boost. Failing pages may be penalised, especially on mobile where competition is tight.
faq.technicalSeo3Q: Can you fix our structured data errors?
faq.technicalSeo3A: Yes. We audit and fix all structured data issues including missing schema markup, validation errors, and warnings. We implement Organization, LocalBusiness, Product, FAQ, and BreadcrumbList schemas as relevant.
faq.technicalSeo4Q: How often should technical SEO be audited?
faq.technicalSeo4A: We recommend quarterly technical audits to catch new issues from content changes, plugin updates, and algorithm changes. Monthly monitoring of Search Console catches critical issues between full audits.
faq.localSeo1Q: How important is Google Business Profile for local SEO?
faq.localSeo1A: Google Business Profile is the single most important factor for local search rankings. A fully optimised profile with reviews, photos, and regular posts significantly increases your visibility in local results and Google Maps.
faq.localSeo2Q: How long does local SEO take to show results?
faq.localSeo2A: Google Business Profile improvements can show impact within two to four weeks. Local citation building and content creation typically take two to three months to noticeably improve local rankings.
faq.localSeo3A: Yes. We set up review request automation, monitor new reviews across platforms, and provide response templates. A steady flow of genuine positive reviews improves both rankings and customer trust.
faq.localSeo4Q: Can you do local SEO for multiple cities?
faq.localSeo4A: Yes. We create geo-targeted landing pages for each city you serve with unique local content, not just templated pages. Each city page targets local keywords and references relevant local projects and clients.
faq.contentSeo1Q: How many articles should we publish per month?
faq.contentSeo1A: Quality matters more than quantity. We recommend two to four well-researched, long-form articles per month for most businesses. Consistency over months compounds into significant organic traffic growth.
faq.contentSeo2Q: Do you write the content or do we?
faq.contentSeo2A: Both options are available. We can write content directly or create detailed content briefs for your team or writers. Briefs include target keywords, outline, word count, internal links, and metadata guidelines.
faq.contentSeo3Q: What is topic clustering and why does it matter?
faq.contentSeo3A: Topic clustering groups related content around a central pillar page. This signals topical authority to Google and improves rankings for the entire cluster. It is more effective than publishing isolated articles.
faq.contentSeo4Q: How do you measure content performance?
faq.contentSeo4A: We track rankings for target keywords, organic traffic per article, time on page, and conversions attributed to content. Underperforming content is refreshed and re-optimised in our continuous improvement cycle.
faq.linkBuilding1Q: What makes a backlink high quality?
faq.linkBuilding1A: Relevant website in your industry, strong domain authority, editorial context around the link, and natural anchor text. One quality backlink from a respected publication outperforms hundreds of directory links.
faq.linkBuilding2A: No. We only use white-hat link building methods including digital PR, guest posting, and broken link outreach. Buying links violates Google guidelines and risks penalisation that can destroy your rankings.
faq.linkBuilding3Q: How many links can you build per month?
faq.linkBuilding3A: Quality link building typically yields 5 to 15 new referring domains per month depending on your industry. We focus on relevance and authority rather than volume. Each link is earned through genuine value.
faq.linkBuilding4Q: How long until link building affects rankings?
faq.linkBuilding4A: New links typically take four to eight weeks to influence rankings. The full impact of a link building campaign becomes clear over three to six months as domain authority grows cumulatively.
faq.seoConsulting1Q: How is SEO consulting different from SEO services?
faq.seoConsulting1A: SEO services mean we do the work. SEO consulting means we guide your team. You get strategic direction, training, and expert review while your internal team handles execution. It is more cost-effective for teams with capacity.
faq.seoConsulting2Q: How often do consulting sessions happen?
faq.seoConsulting2A: Monthly or bi-weekly depending on your needs and pace of implementation. Each session reviews progress, analyses data, adjusts strategy, and sets priorities for the next period.
faq.seoConsulting3Q: Can you train our marketing team on SEO?
faq.seoConsulting3A: Yes. We conduct customised workshops on technical SEO, content optimisation, keyword research, and analytics. Training is tailored to your team's skill level and the specific tools they use.
faq.seoConsulting4Q: What deliverables do we get from consulting?
faq.seoConsulting4A: An initial SEO roadmap, monthly strategy session notes with task lists, quarterly performance reviews, content feedback on demand, and team training materials. All documented and actionable.
faq.googleAds1Q: What is a reasonable Google Ads budget for European markets?
faq.googleAds1A: We recommend a minimum of EUR 500 per month per market. This provides enough data for meaningful optimisation. Our management fee starts at EUR 247 per month on top of ad spend.
faq.googleAds2Q: How quickly will Google Ads generate leads?
faq.googleAds2A: Ads can generate traffic from day one. However, the first two weeks are an optimisation period where we refine targeting, bids, and ad copy. Meaningful lead volume typically stabilises within four to six weeks.
faq.googleAds3Q: Do you manage ads in multiple languages?
faq.googleAds3A: Yes. We create separate campaigns for each language and market with localised keyword research, ad copy, and landing pages. Each market is optimised independently based on its performance data.
faq.googleAds4Q: How do you measure Google Ads ROI?
faq.googleAds4A: We set up conversion tracking from day one measuring leads, sales, and phone calls. Monthly reports show cost per acquisition, return on ad spend, and which campaigns deliver the best results.
faq.analyticsSetup1Q: Why should I switch to Google Analytics 4?
faq.analyticsSetup1A: Universal Analytics stopped processing data in 2024. GA4 is now the only supported version. It offers event-based tracking, cross-platform measurement, and machine learning insights that UA could not provide.
faq.analyticsSetup2Q: What is Consent Mode v2 and is it mandatory?
faq.analyticsSetup2A: Consent Mode v2 communicates user consent to Google services. It is mandatory for EU websites using Google Analytics or Ads since March 2024. Without it, you risk data collection violations and inaccurate reporting.
faq.analyticsSetup3Q: Can you set up custom event tracking?
faq.analyticsSetup3A: Yes. We track any user action including form submissions, button clicks, scroll depth, video plays, file downloads, and custom business events. Each event is named and parameterised for clear reporting.
faq.analyticsSetup4A: Yes. We build custom Looker Studio dashboards showing traffic, behaviour, and conversion data. Dashboards are shared with your team and can be emailed automatically on a weekly or monthly schedule.
faq.uxUiDesign1Q: What is the difference between UX and UI design?
faq.uxUiDesign1A: UX design focuses on how a product works: user flows, information architecture, and interaction patterns. UI design focuses on how it looks: colours, typography, and visual style. Both are essential for effective digital products.
faq.uxUiDesign2A: Yes. We conduct stakeholder interviews, user interviews, competitive analysis, and usability testing. For European projects, we research cross-cultural design expectations for each target market.
faq.uxUiDesign3Q: Which design tools do you use?
faq.uxUiDesign3A: Figma is our primary design tool. We create wireframes, visual designs, interactive prototypes, and design system components all within Figma for seamless collaboration and developer handoff.
faq.uxUiDesign4Q: How many design revisions are included?
faq.uxUiDesign4A: We include three rounds of revisions in every project. Most designs are finalised within two rounds. Our iterative process with wireframes and prototypes reduces major revisions by validating concepts early.
faq.digitalStrategy1Q: What does a digital strategy include?
faq.digitalStrategy1A: Market analysis, competitor research, channel evaluation, quarterly roadmap with initiatives and budgets, KPI framework, and ongoing review sessions. It answers how your business should grow online.
faq.digitalStrategy2Q: How long does developing a digital strategy take?
faq.digitalStrategy2A: Initial strategy development takes three to four weeks including research, analysis, and roadmap creation. Ongoing consulting with quarterly reviews ensures the strategy adapts to market changes and results.
faq.digitalStrategy3Q: Is digital strategy worth it for small businesses?
faq.digitalStrategy3A: Especially for small businesses. Limited budgets make strategic allocation critical. A clear strategy prevents wasting money on ineffective channels and focuses resources where they deliver the most return.
faq.digitalStrategy4Q: Do you help implement the strategy or just plan it?
faq.digitalStrategy4A: Both. We develop the strategy and can also execute it through our web development, SEO, and marketing services. Alternatively, we provide consulting to guide your internal team through implementation.
faq.brandIdentity1Q: How long does brand identity design take?
faq.brandIdentity1A: A complete brand identity including strategy, logo, colour palette, typography, and guidelines takes four to six weeks. The process includes multiple concept presentations and refinement rounds.
faq.brandIdentity2Q: How many logo concepts do you present?
faq.brandIdentity2A: We present three to five distinct logo concepts, each exploring a different creative direction. After you select a direction, we refine it through two to three rounds of revisions to perfection.
faq.brandIdentity3A: Yes. Every brand identity project includes a comprehensive guidelines document covering logo usage, colour specifications, typography rules, imagery direction, and tone of voice recommendations.
faq.brandIdentity4Q: Can you redesign our existing brand identity?
faq.brandIdentity4A: Yes. We can either refresh your existing brand with modernised elements or create an entirely new identity. We assess which approach serves your business goals best during the strategy phase.
faq.designSystems1A: A design system is a collection of reusable components, design tokens, and guidelines that ensure consistency across your digital products. It is the single source of truth for how your products look and behave.
faq.designSystems2Q: When does a business need a design system?
faq.designSystems2A: When you have multiple digital products, multiple teams contributing to the same product, or inconsistency in your UI. Design systems pay for themselves through reduced development time and improved consistency.
faq.designSystems3Q: Do you build design systems in both Figma and code?
faq.designSystems3A: Yes. Our design systems include Figma component libraries with auto-layout and variants, plus React component libraries with TypeScript and Storybook. Both libraries use matching naming conventions.
faq.designSystems4Q: How do you handle design system governance?
faq.designSystems4A: We establish contribution guidelines, review processes, and versioning strategies. New components follow a proposal, design, build, and release workflow. Breaking changes include migration guides.
faq.prototyping1Q: What fidelity level is right for my project?
faq.prototyping1A: Low-fidelity wireframes test navigation and flow concepts. Medium-fidelity tests visual design and interactions. High-fidelity tests the complete experience. We recommend the lowest fidelity that answers your validation questions.
faq.prototyping2Q: How quickly can you build a prototype?
faq.prototyping2A: Low-fidelity wireframe prototypes in one to two days. Medium-fidelity interactive prototypes in three to five days. High-fidelity coded prototypes in one to two weeks depending on complexity.
faq.prototyping3Q: Do you test prototypes with real users?
faq.prototyping3A: Yes. We recruit participants matching your target audience, facilitate usability testing sessions, and provide analysis with prioritised recommendations. Testing can be conducted in English, French, Dutch, or German.
faq.prototyping4Q: Can a prototype be used for investor presentations?
faq.prototyping4A: Absolutely. High-fidelity prototypes are nearly indistinguishable from real products. They demonstrate your concept convincingly for investor pitches, board presentations, and stakeholder buy-in meetings.
faq.contentMarketing1Q: How is content marketing different from blogging?
faq.contentMarketing1A: Content marketing is a strategic approach that includes blogs, case studies, guides, whitepapers, and more. Each piece serves a specific business objective and targets defined audience segments at different buyer journey stages.
faq.contentMarketing2Q: How long until content marketing generates leads?
faq.contentMarketing2A: Content marketing is a compounding investment. Initial results in organic traffic appear in two to three months. Meaningful lead generation typically starts at four to six months with consistent, strategic publishing.
faq.contentMarketing3Q: Do you create content in multiple European languages?
faq.contentMarketing3A: Yes. We create and adapt content in English, French, Dutch, and German. Each language version is culturally adapted rather than directly translated, ensuring it resonates with the local audience.
faq.contentMarketing4Q: What types of content convert best for B2B?
faq.contentMarketing4A: Case studies and comparison guides are the highest-converting B2B content types. They provide social proof and help buyers evaluate options. Blog posts drive awareness, while guides and whitepapers generate email signups.
faq.customApps1Q: How long does it take to build a custom web application?
faq.customApps1A: A simple dashboard or portal takes 4-8 weeks. A mid-complexity application with authentication, roles, and integrations takes 8-16 weeks. Complex SaaS platforms can take 16-24 weeks. We deliver working increments every two weeks so you see progress and can provide feedback early and often.
faq.customApps2Q: What backend technology do you use for custom applications?
faq.customApps2A: Our primary backend is Supabase, providing PostgreSQL, real-time subscriptions, authentication, storage, and edge functions. For complex business logic, we add Node.js microservices. This combination delivers enterprise-grade capabilities without the cost and complexity of traditional backend infrastructure.
faq.customApps3Q: How do you handle data security in custom applications?
faq.customApps3A: Security is built into every layer: row-level security in PostgreSQL, JWT authentication with refresh token rotation, input validation with Zod schemas, rate limiting on all endpoints, and encryption in transit and at rest. We follow OWASP security guidelines and conduct security reviews before every production deployment.
faq.customApps4Q: Can you integrate with our existing business systems?
faq.customApps4A: Yes, we build API integrations with CRMs (HubSpot, Salesforce), accounting software (Xero, QuickBooks), ERP systems, and any tool with a REST or GraphQL API. We design integration layers with proper error handling and retry logic so your systems stay synchronized reliably.
faq.redesign1Q: Will a redesign affect our current Google rankings?
faq.redesign1A: When done correctly, a redesign should improve your rankings. We create comprehensive 301 redirect maps, preserve existing URL structures where possible, maintain or improve content quality, and monitor Search Console closely post-launch. Our migration checklist covers 87 items specifically to prevent traffic loss during the transition.
faq.redesign2Q: How long does a website redesign typically take?
faq.redesign2A: A small business site (5-10 pages) takes 3-5 weeks including the audit phase. A larger site with 20+ pages, e-commerce, or complex functionality takes 6-12 weeks. We always begin with a two-week audit and strategy phase to ensure the redesign is driven by data rather than assumptions.
faq.redesign3Q: Can we keep our current CMS during a redesign?
faq.redesign3A: If your current CMS works well for your editors, we can use it as a headless backend and build a modern React frontend that consumes its content via API. This gives you a fast new website without requiring your team to learn a new content management system. WordPress to headless is our most common migration path.
faq.redesign4Q: What if our current site is on WordPress -- can you still redesign it?
faq.redesign4A: Yes, WordPress redesigns are our most frequent project type. We either build a custom React frontend using WordPress as a headless CMS, or migrate content entirely to a modern stack like Next.js with Payload CMS. The approach depends on your team's comfort with content management and your long-term technology goals.
faq.maintenance1Q: What does your monthly care plan include?
faq.maintenance1A: Our EUR 97/month care plan includes weekly dependency updates, monthly security scans, uptime monitoring with alerts, daily automated backups, content updates within one business day, monthly performance reports, priority support with 4-hour response time, and quarterly strategy reviews with optimization recommendations.
faq.maintenance2Q: How quickly do you respond to urgent issues?
faq.maintenance2A: Care plan clients get priority support with a 4-hour response time guarantee during business hours (9:00-18:00 CET). For critical issues like site downtime or security breaches, we provide emergency response within one hour. Non-urgent requests are addressed within one business day.
faq.maintenance3Q: Can you maintain a website that someone else built?
faq.maintenance3A: Yes, we maintain sites built by other agencies or developers, provided the codebase is in a modern framework we support (React, Next.js, Vue, or standard HTML/CSS). We begin with a codebase audit to understand the architecture, identify technical debt, and establish a baseline before starting regular maintenance.
faq.maintenance4Q: What happens if we want to cancel the care plan?
faq.maintenance4A: Our care plans require a 30-day notice to cancel. Upon cancellation, we provide full access to all source code, hosting credentials, and documentation. We also offer a transition period where we brief your new developer or agency on the codebase architecture and ongoing maintenance requirements.
faq.gdpr1Q: What does GDPR compliance require for a business website?
faq.gdpr1A: At minimum: a cookie consent banner that blocks non-essential cookies until consent, a comprehensive privacy policy, explicit consent checkboxes on forms, data processing agreements with third-party tools, and the ability to handle data subject requests (access, deletion, portability). The specifics vary by country and the data you collect.
faq.gdpr2Q: Is a simple cookie banner enough for GDPR compliance?
faq.gdpr2A: No. A compliant cookie banner must block all non-essential scripts before consent, offer granular category choices (not just accept/reject), store consent proof with timestamps, and allow users to change their preferences. Many popular cookie banner solutions are not actually compliant. We implement Consent Mode v2 which meets the strictest EU requirements.
faq.gdpr3Q: Do we need a Data Protection Officer (DPO)?
faq.gdpr3A: GDPR requires a DPO for public authorities, organizations processing data at scale, or those handling sensitive data categories. Most small to medium European businesses do not need a formal DPO, but they do need someone responsible for data protection. We can advise on your specific obligation and connect you with DPO consultants if needed.
faq.gdpr4Q: How do you handle GDPR for multilingual websites?
faq.gdpr4A: Privacy policies and cookie consent must be available in every language your website supports. We draft legally compliant policies in English, French, Dutch, and German, adapting to country-specific requirements (German UWG requires double opt-in for newsletters, French CNIL has specific cookie guidelines). Each language version references the applicable local regulations.
faq.wooDev1Q: Why choose WooCommerce over Shopify for European e-commerce?
faq.wooDev1A: WooCommerce offers full code ownership, no monthly platform fees, unlimited customisation, and no transaction fees beyond your payment provider's charges. It is ideal for businesses needing custom plugins, complex tax setups, or integration with specific European ERP systems.
faq.wooDev2Q: Which payment gateways do you integrate with WooCommerce?
faq.wooDev2A: We integrate Mollie (iDEAL, Bancontact, Belfius), Stripe, Adyen, Klarna, PayPal, and SEPA direct debit. Each gateway is configured with PSD2-compliant 3D Secure authentication and tested with real transactions before launch.
faq.wooDev3Q: How do you handle EU VAT compliance in WooCommerce?
faq.wooDev3A: We configure automatic VAT rate calculation per EU country, implement VAT number validation via VIES for B2B reverse charge, set up OSS reporting for cross-border sales, and ensure all invoices meet EU electronic invoicing requirements.
faq.wooDev4Q: Can WooCommerce handle high traffic volumes?
faq.wooDev4A: With proper hosting, caching, and optimisation, WooCommerce handles thousands of concurrent users. We configure Redis object caching, CDN delivery, database optimisation, and autoscaling infrastructure for peak traffic periods like Black Friday.
faq.customEcom1Q: When should a business choose custom e-commerce over Shopify or WooCommerce?
faq.customEcom1A: Custom development is the right choice when your business model requires unique checkout flows, complex product configurators, marketplace functionality, or deep integrations that standard platforms cannot accommodate without excessive workarounds.
faq.customEcom2Q: What headless commerce backends do you work with?
faq.customEcom2A: We work with Medusa.js for open-source flexibility, Saleor for GraphQL-first architecture, and Commercetools for enterprise-scale operations. Backend selection depends on your transaction volume, customisation needs, and budget.
faq.customEcom3Q: How long does a custom e-commerce build take?
faq.customEcom3A: A custom store typically takes 8 to 16 weeks depending on complexity. We work in two-week sprints with continuous delivery, so you see working functionality from week two onward rather than waiting for a big-bang launch.
faq.customEcom4Q: What about ongoing maintenance for a custom store?
faq.customEcom4A: We offer maintenance plans covering security updates, performance monitoring, bug fixes, and feature enhancements. Custom stores require more technical maintenance than hosted platforms, but you gain complete control and zero platform lock-in.
faq.b2bEcom1Q: How does B2B e-commerce pricing work with customer-specific rates?
faq.b2bEcom1A: Each customer account is assigned to a pricing tier with pre-negotiated rates. When buyers log in, they see only their contracted prices. Volume discounts are calculated automatically at checkout, and sales teams can override pricing for special orders.
faq.b2bEcom2Q: Can the platform handle ordering by CSV upload?
faq.b2bEcom2A: Yes. Bulk ordering supports CSV upload with SKU and quantity columns, quick-order forms for entering multiple products, and saved order templates for repeat purchases. These features are essential for B2B buyers who order dozens of items at once.
faq.b2bEcom3Q: How do you handle VAT for cross-border B2B sales in the EU?
faq.b2bEcom3A: We validate buyer VAT numbers against the EU VIES database in real time. Valid B2B buyers from other EU member states automatically receive reverse charge treatment with zero VAT. All transaction data is captured for Intrastat and EC Sales List reporting.
faq.b2bEcom4Q: Can the B2B store integrate with our existing ERP system?
faq.b2bEcom4A: Yes. We build integrations with SAP Business One, Microsoft Dynamics, Exact Online, and other European ERP systems. Product data, pricing, stock levels, and orders sync bidirectionally so your online store and back-office stay aligned.
faq.paymentInt1Q: Which payment method has the highest conversion rate in Europe?
faq.paymentInt1A: It varies by country. iDEAL converts at over 90 percent in the Netherlands, Bancontact dominates Belgium, and Klarna leads in Germany and Scandinavia. Card payments remain important across all markets. We recommend offering three to four methods per market.
faq.paymentInt2Q: What is PSD2 and how does it affect our checkout?
faq.paymentInt2A: PSD2 requires Strong Customer Authentication for European card payments, typically via 3D Secure 2.0. We implement frictionless authentication flows that minimise checkout abandonment while meeting regulatory requirements. Exemptions are applied where eligible.
faq.paymentInt3Q: How do you handle recurring payments and subscriptions?
faq.paymentInt3A: We implement SEPA direct debit for eurozone recurring payments and Stripe's subscription billing for card-based recurring charges. Mandate management, payment retry logic, and dunning workflows are all configured to minimise involuntary churn.
faq.paymentInt4Q: What happens if a payment provider has downtime?
faq.paymentInt4A: We configure fallback payment routes where possible. If Mollie experiences downtime, customers can still pay via Stripe. Webhook-based status tracking ensures orders are not lost during provider interruptions. Alert monitoring notifies you immediately of any issues.
faq.ecomSeo1Q: How is e-commerce SEO different from regular website SEO?
faq.ecomSeo1A: E-commerce SEO involves product schema markup, faceted navigation management, thin content on product pages, index bloat from filter combinations, and Google Shopping feed optimisation. These challenges require specialised techniques beyond standard on-page SEO.
faq.ecomSeo2Q: Can you optimise our Google Shopping listings?
faq.ecomSeo2A: Yes. We set up and optimise your Google Merchant Center feed with proper product titles, descriptions, GTINs, and pricing data. Feed rules ensure your products show correctly across all target markets with localised pricing and availability.
faq.ecomSeo3Q: How do you handle SEO for products with many variants?
faq.ecomSeo3A: We implement canonical URLs to consolidate ranking signals across variants, use structured data to surface variant options in search results, and create optimised descriptions that target variant-specific search queries like colour or size combinations.
faq.ecomSeo4Q: What results can we expect from e-commerce SEO?
faq.ecomSeo4A: Typically, we see 30 to 80 percent increases in organic product page traffic within six months. Product rich results improve click-through rates by 20 to 35 percent. Google Shopping feed optimisation can double impression share in target markets.
faq.ecomAnalytics1Q: What is GA4 enhanced e-commerce tracking?
faq.ecomAnalytics1A: Enhanced e-commerce tracks the complete shopping journey: product views, add-to-cart actions, checkout steps, purchases, and refunds. Each event carries product details enabling analysis of which products, categories, and price points drive revenue.
faq.ecomAnalytics2Q: How do you handle tracking accuracy with ad blockers?
faq.ecomAnalytics2A: We implement server-side tracking through Google Tag Manager's server container. This routes analytics data through your own domain, bypassing most ad blockers. Consent mode v2 ensures GDPR compliance while recovering up to 70 percent of blocked data.
faq.ecomAnalytics3Q: What KPIs should an e-commerce store track?
faq.ecomAnalytics3A: Essential KPIs include conversion rate, average order value, revenue per visitor, cart abandonment rate, customer acquisition cost, and customer lifetime value. We build dashboards that surface these metrics by market, channel, and device for European stores.
faq.ecomAnalytics4Q: Can you set up analytics for stores selling in multiple EU countries?
faq.ecomAnalytics4A: Yes. We configure market-segmented reporting so you can compare performance across countries. Cross-domain tracking handles multi-language storefronts, and currency normalisation ensures revenue comparisons are accurate regardless of the transaction currency.
faq.intlSeo1Q: Should I use separate domains for each country or subdirectories?
faq.intlSeo1A: For most European businesses, subdirectories (example.com/fr/, example.com/de/) offer the best balance of authority consolidation and geo-targeting. Country-code domains are better only when you have strong existing domain authority per market.
faq.intlSeo2Q: How do you handle keyword research in languages you do not speak natively?
faq.intlSeo2A: We work with native-speaking SEO specialists for each target language. Machine translation misses search intent nuances. Our French, Dutch, and German keyword research reflects actual local search behaviour, not translated English queries.
faq.intlSeo3Q: What is hreflang and why does it matter for my site?
faq.intlSeo3A: Hreflang tells Google which language and country each page targets, preventing the wrong version from ranking in the wrong market. Without it, your French page might rank in the UK, cannibalising your English page's traffic.
faq.intlSeo4Q: Can international SEO work alongside Google Ads for new markets?
faq.intlSeo4A: Absolutely. We often recommend Google Ads for immediate visibility in new markets while international SEO builds organic presence over 3-6 months. The keyword data from ads informs SEO strategy for faster results.
faq.marketingAuto1Q: Which marketing automation platform do you recommend?
faq.marketingAuto1A: It depends on your needs and budget. Mailchimp suits small businesses and e-commerce. HubSpot is ideal for B2B with complex sales cycles. ActiveCampaign offers the best automation features for its price. We help you choose the right fit.
faq.marketingAuto2Q: How do you ensure automated emails comply with GDPR?
faq.marketingAuto2A: Every automation includes proper consent capture, easy unsubscribe in every email, data processing documentation, and retention policies. We configure double opt-in for European contacts and maintain suppression lists across all platforms.
faq.marketingAuto3Q: What kind of ROI can I expect from marketing automation?
faq.marketingAuto3A: Clients typically see 15-25% increases in lead-to-customer conversion rates within the first quarter. Automated nurture sequences recover leads that would otherwise go cold, and cart abandonment emails alone can recover 10-15% of lost revenue.
faq.marketingAuto4Q: Can automation work with my existing CRM system?
faq.marketingAuto4A: Yes. We integrate with Salesforce, HubSpot CRM, Pipedrive, and most modern CRM platforms via native integrations or Zapier. Bi-directional sync ensures your sales team sees every marketing touchpoint in their existing workflow.
faq.geoOpt1Q: What is the difference between GEO and traditional SEO?
faq.geoOpt1A: Traditional SEO optimises for search engine result pages. GEO optimises for AI-generated answers in platforms like ChatGPT and Perplexity. Both are important, but GEO specifically targets how AI systems cite and recommend your brand.
faq.geoOpt2Q: Can I track whether AI platforms are mentioning my brand?
faq.geoOpt2A: Yes. We use a combination of manual query testing across AI platforms and emerging monitoring tools to track brand mentions, accuracy, and sentiment in AI-generated responses. Monthly reports show visibility trends.
faq.geoOpt3Q: Is GEO relevant for small European businesses or only large brands?
faq.geoOpt3A: GEO is relevant for any business whose customers use AI search. Local service businesses benefit when ChatGPT or Google AI Overviews recommend providers. Early adoption creates a competitive advantage as AI search usage grows rapidly.
faq.geoOpt4Q: How quickly does GEO optimisation show results?
faq.geoOpt4A: AI systems update their knowledge bases at different rates. Google AI Overviews reflect changes within weeks. ChatGPT and Perplexity may take 1-3 months to surface new citations. Early and consistent effort compounds into strong AI visibility.
faq.mobileFirst1Q: Why should we design mobile-first instead of desktop-first?
faq.mobileFirst1A: Over sixty percent of European web traffic comes from mobile devices. Designing mobile-first forces content prioritisation, cleaner hierarchy and faster performance. Desktop enhancements are then added progressively, resulting in a better experience on every screen size.
faq.mobileFirst2Q: How do you handle complex interfaces on small screens?
faq.mobileFirst2A: We use progressive disclosure -- showing essential content first and revealing detail on demand through expandable sections, bottom sheets and contextual navigation. Complex data tables become swipeable cards. Multi-step forms are broken into focused single-field screens.
faq.mobileFirst3Q: What performance targets do you aim for on mobile?
faq.mobileFirst3A: We target sub-two-second Largest Contentful Paint on 4G connections, Total Blocking Time under 150 milliseconds and Cumulative Layout Shift below 0.05. These Core Web Vitals targets ensure fast loading, smooth interactivity and stable layouts on real devices.
faq.mobileFirst4Q: Do you test on real devices or just browser emulators?
faq.mobileFirst4A: Both. Initial development uses browser DevTools for rapid iteration, but final testing occurs on a physical device lab covering iOS Safari, Android Chrome, Samsung Internet and common viewport sizes. Network throttling simulates real 3G and 4G conditions in each target market.

gdpr.title: GDPR COMPLIANCE
gdpr.desc: Cookie consent implementation, privacy policies, data processing agreements, and compliant contact forms. Full GDPR and ePrivacy Directive compliance for EU-operating websites.
gdpr.longDesc:
GDPR compliance for websites is not just about adding a cookie banner -- it is a comprehensive approach to data protection that European regulators actively enforce. Fines under GDPR can reach EUR 20 million or 4% of global turnover, and enforcement has intensified significantly since 2022 with the French CNIL, German BfDI, and Dutch AP issuing penalties to businesses of all sizes. Our GDPR compliance service ensures your website handles personal data correctly, from the moment a visitor loads your page to the point their data is deleted.

Cookie consent is the most visible compliance requirement and the one most websites get wrong. We implement Consent Mode v2 with Google Tag Manager, which is required for running Google Ads in the EU since March 2024. Our implementation blocks all non-essential cookies and scripts until the user gives explicit consent, provides granular options (analytics, marketing, functional cookies as separate categories), stores consent proof with timestamp and user agent for audit purposes, and re-requests consent when your cookie policy changes. The consent banner adapts per country -- Germany requires strict opt-in while some other jurisdictions accept implied consent for analytics.

Beyond cookies, we ensure your data collection points are fully compliant. Contact forms include explicit consent checkboxes with links to your privacy policy. Newsletter signups use double opt-in (required in Germany under UWG). File uploads are scanned and stored securely with access controls. Your privacy policy is written in plain language (GDPR Article 12 requires clear communication), covers all required disclosures including data retention periods, third-party processors, international transfers, and user rights, and is available in all languages your website supports.

We also implement the technical infrastructure for data subject rights. Users have the right to access their data, request corrections, demand deletion, and export their data in a portable format. We build these capabilities into your application: a self-service data export function, account deletion workflows that cascade through all data stores, and audit logging that records who accessed personal data and when. For businesses using Supabase, we configure row-level security policies that enforce data isolation between users and implement automatic data retention policies that delete inactive user data after your specified retention period.

International SEO is fundamentally different from domestic SEO. Ranking in multiple European countries requires market-specific strategies, proper technical implementation, and cultural understanding of each audience. Our international SEO service helps European businesses expand their organic reach across borders with strategies tailored to each target market.

Market-specific keyword research is the starting point. Search behaviour varies significantly between countries. A French business owner searches differently from a British one, even when looking for the same service. We conduct keyword research in each target language using native understanding of search intent, colloquialisms, and industry terminology. This is not translation — it is market-native research.

Hreflang implementation is the technical backbone of international SEO. We ensure every page correctly signals its language and regional targeting to search engines. Hreflang tags in HTML headers or XML sitemaps prevent duplicate content issues between language versions and ensure the right page appears for users in each country. We handle complex scenarios including regional variants, language fallbacks, and x-default targeting.

URL structure strategy determines how your international content is organised. We recommend the right approach for your situation: subdirectories for most businesses, subdomains for significantly different products per market, or country-code domains for maximum local authority. Each approach has trade-offs that we evaluate based on your specific goals and resources.

Content localisation goes beyond translation. Each market version of your content is adapted for local culture, business norms, legal requirements, and user expectations. Case studies reference local clients, pricing reflects local currency, and calls to action use locally appropriate language. This cultural adaptation dramatically improves engagement and conversion rates.

International link building strengthens your authority in each target market. We build relationships with local industry publications, participate in regional directories, and create linkable content that resonates with each national audience. Domain authority in one country does not automatically transfer to another, so market-specific link building is essential.

Performance is tracked per market with country-specific ranking reports, organic traffic segmentation, and conversion rate analysis by language. Monthly reports show which markets are growing, where opportunities exist, and what actions will drive the most impact in the next period.

geoOpt.desc: Generative Engine Optimization for AI search platforms including ChatGPT, Perplexity, Google AI Overviews, and Copilot. Ensure your brand appears when AI answers your customers' questions.
geoOpt.longDesc:
The search landscape is undergoing its most significant shift since Google replaced directories. AI-powered search platforms like ChatGPT, Perplexity, Google AI Overviews, and Microsoft Copilot are increasingly the first place people go for answers. These systems synthesise information from across the web and present direct answers, often without requiring a click to your website. If your brand is not part of those synthesised answers, you are invisible to a growing segment of your audience. Generative Engine Optimization (GEO) is the discipline of ensuring your brand and content are cited by AI systems.

GEO starts with understanding how large language models source information. AI systems prioritise content that demonstrates clear expertise, provides structured and quotable data points, maintains factual accuracy with citations, and comes from domains with established authority. We audit your content through the lens of AI retrievability: Is your content structured in ways that AI can easily extract and cite? Do your pages contain clear, authoritative statements that AI would choose to reference? Are your entity relationships (brand, products, people) clearly defined across the web?

Our optimisation approach targets the specific signals that AI search platforms weight. We implement comprehensive entity markup using Schema.org vocabulary so AI systems can accurately identify and categorise your business, services, and expertise. We create content specifically designed for AI citation: definitive statistics, expert-attributed insights, structured comparisons, and authoritative how-to content. We optimise your presence on platforms that AI systems heavily reference, including Wikipedia, industry databases, major publications, and structured knowledge sources.

For European businesses, GEO includes multilingual AI visibility. ChatGPT, Perplexity, and Google AI Overviews serve responses in the user's language, drawing from content in that language. We ensure your brand is well-represented in French, English, Dutch, and German AI results. We also monitor your AI search visibility using emerging tools and manual query testing, tracking how often your brand is mentioned, how accurately it is represented, and where competitors are being cited instead. This is a rapidly evolving field, and our strategies adapt as AI search capabilities expand.

mobileFirst.title: MOBILE-FIRST DESIGN
mobileFirst.desc: Mobile-first responsive design ensuring flawless experiences on phones, tablets, and desktops. With 60%+ of traffic coming from mobile, your website must be designed for small screens first.
mobileFirst.longDesc:
Mobile traffic accounts for over 60% of web visits in Europe. Google uses mobile-first indexing, meaning your mobile experience determines your search rankings. Yet many websites are still designed for desktop and squeezed onto mobile as an afterthought. Our mobile-first design service flips this approach, creating experiences that are exceptional on mobile and scale up beautifully to larger screens.

Mobile-first means we design the mobile experience before the desktop experience. This constraint forces prioritisation of the most important content and actions. When you have limited screen space, every element must earn its place. This clarity of purpose benefits the desktop experience too, resulting in cleaner, more focused designs at every screen size.

Touch interaction design considers how people actually use mobile devices. We design touch targets that are at least 44x44 pixels for comfortable tapping. Navigation patterns are optimised for thumb reach zones. Swipe gestures are used where they feel natural. Pull-to-refresh, bottom navigation, and floating action buttons follow mobile platform conventions that users already understand.

Responsive typography and spacing scale proportionally across devices using CSS clamp functions. Headings that fill a mobile screen are proportionally impactful on desktop without being absurdly large. Line lengths are controlled for readability at every width. Spacing increases with screen size to prevent large-screen designs from feeling cramped.

Performance on mobile networks is a design constraint we take seriously. Images are served in appropriate sizes for each device with srcset and sizes attributes. Above-the-fold content is prioritised for immediate rendering. JavaScript is minimised and deferred. These techniques ensure your website loads fast even on 3G connections common in some European areas.

We test on real devices throughout the design and development process. iOS Safari, Android Chrome, Samsung Internet, and other mobile browsers each have quirks that only real device testing reveals. We test across screen sizes from 320px to 428px on phones, 768px to 1024px on tablets, and 1280px and above on desktop. The result is a website that feels native on every device.

react.title: React
react.desc: The world's most popular UI library for building fast, interactive, component-driven web applications with a virtual DOM.
react.longDesc:
React has fundamentally changed how we build web interfaces. Created by Meta and used by millions of developers worldwide, React's component-based architecture enables us to build complex UIs from small, isolated pieces of code that are easy to test, maintain, and reuse.

At DMC Kreatif, React is at the core of every project we deliver. Its virtual DOM ensures lightning-fast updates, while the massive ecosystem of libraries — from React Router for navigation to React Hook Form for data collection — means we never have to reinvent the wheel.

For European businesses, React offers a critical advantage: its server-side rendering capabilities (via Next.js) and code-splitting features deliver the performance that search engines demand. Combined with TypeScript for type safety, our React applications consistently achieve 95+ Lighthouse scores while remaining easy to maintain and extend as your business grows.
react.why1: Component-based architecture enables rapid development and effortless code reuse across projects
react.why2: Virtual DOM ensures blazing-fast UI updates with minimal browser re-renders
react.why3: Ecosystem of 2M+ npm packages means battle-tested solutions for every requirement
react.why4: Backed by Meta with 220K+ GitHub stars and the largest developer community worldwide
react.f2: Virtual DOM for optimal rendering performance
react.f3: React Hooks for clean state management
react.f5: Code splitting and lazy loading built-in
react.f7: Concurrent rendering for smooth user experiences
react.f8: Massive ecosystem of UI libraries and tools
react.altVueDesc: Progressive JavaScript framework with an approachable learning curve and excellent documentation
react.altVuePros: Gentle learning curve, great docs, reactive data binding, single-file components
react.altVueCons: Smaller enterprise ecosystem, fewer job listings, less third-party library support
react.altAngularDesc: Full-featured MVC framework by Google with built-in dependency injection and TypeScript
react.altAngularPros: Complete solution out of the box, TypeScript-first, strong enterprise adoption
react.altAngularCons: Steeper learning curve, heavier bundle size, more boilerplate code required

nextjs.title: Next.js
nextjs.desc: The full-stack React framework for production-grade web applications with built-in SSR, SSG, and API routes.
nextjs.longDesc:
Next.js by Vercel has become the gold standard for building production React applications. It extends React with powerful features like server-side rendering (SSR), static site generation (SSG), and incremental static regeneration (ISR) — all crucial for SEO and performance.

We choose Next.js for projects where search engine visibility is paramount. Its file-based routing, automatic code splitting, and image optimisation deliver exceptional Core Web Vitals scores out of the box. The App Router introduced in Next.js 13+ brings React Server Components, reducing client-side JavaScript dramatically.

For multilingual European businesses, Next.js offers built-in internationalisation (i18n) routing, making it straightforward to serve content in English, French, Dutch, and German from a single codebase. Combined with Vercel's edge network, your site loads in under a second from anywhere in Europe.
nextjs.why1: Built-in SSR and SSG deliver exceptional SEO performance for European markets
nextjs.why2: Automatic code splitting reduces initial load by up to 70% compared to SPAs
nextjs.why3: Native i18n routing makes multilingual sites effortless across EN, FR, NL, DE
nextjs.why4: Vercel edge deployment ensures sub-second load times across all of Europe
nextjs.f1: Server-side rendering for instant page loads
nextjs.f2: Static site generation for maximum performance
nextjs.altGatsbyDesc: Static site generator built on React with a rich plugin ecosystem and GraphQL data layer
nextjs.altGatsbyPros: Excellent for content sites, huge plugin library, GraphQL data layer
nextjs.altGatsbyCons: Slow builds at scale, limited SSR, declining community momentum
nextjs.altRemixDesc: Full-stack web framework focused on web standards and progressive enhancement
nextjs.altRemixPros: Excellent data loading patterns, progressive enhancement, web standards-first
nextjs.altRemixCons: Smaller ecosystem, fewer hosting options, newer community

typescript.title: TypeScript
typescript.desc: JavaScript with static type checking that catches bugs before they reach production, improving code quality and developer productivity.
typescript.longDesc:
TypeScript adds static type checking to JavaScript, catching entire categories of bugs at compile time rather than in production. For European businesses where reliability is non-negotiable, TypeScript is our insurance policy against runtime errors.

Every project at DMC Kreatif uses TypeScript in strict mode. This means every variable, function parameter, and return value has an explicit type, making our codebase self-documenting and significantly easier to maintain. When we hand over a project, your development team can understand the code instantly.

TypeScript's integration with modern IDEs provides intelligent autocomplete, inline documentation, and automated refactoring that dramatically speeds up development. The result is fewer bugs, faster delivery, and code that remains maintainable for years to come.
typescript.why1: Catches 15-20% of bugs at compile time before they ever reach production
typescript.why2: Self-documenting code with explicit types makes handover and maintenance effortless
typescript.why3: IDE integration provides intelligent autocomplete and automated refactoring
typescript.why4: Industry standard adopted by 78% of JavaScript developers for production apps
typescript.f1: Static type checking catches bugs early
typescript.f2: Interface and type definitions for APIs
typescript.f6: Strict null checks prevent runtime errors
typescript.altJsDesc: The original dynamic scripting language of the web with no type system overhead
typescript.altJsPros: No compilation step, zero learning curve for web devs, maximum flexibility
typescript.altJsCons: No type safety, runtime errors in production, harder to refactor at scale
typescript.altFlowDesc: Static type checker for JavaScript by Meta with gradual typing support
typescript.altFlowPros: Gradual adoption, good React integration, sound type system
typescript.altFlowCons: Declining community, fewer IDE integrations, limited library support

vite.title: Vite
vite.desc: Next-generation build tool with instant hot module replacement and optimised production builds powered by Rollup.
vite.longDesc:
Vite has revolutionised the JavaScript build tool landscape. Created by Evan You (the creator of Vue.js), Vite leverages native ES modules in the browser during development, delivering instant server start and lightning-fast hot module replacement (HMR) regardless of application size.

At DMC Kreatif, Vite is our default build tool for all React projects that don't require Next.js. Its development experience is unmatched — changes appear in the browser in under 50ms, making the feedback loop nearly instantaneous. For production, Vite uses Rollup under the hood, producing highly optimised bundles with automatic code splitting.

Vite's plugin ecosystem is fully compatible with Rollup plugins, giving us access to thousands of battle-tested tools. Combined with its first-class TypeScript and CSS Modules support, Vite delivers the perfect balance of developer experience and production performance.
vite.why1: Instant server start and sub-50ms HMR make development 10x faster than Webpack
vite.why2: Rollup-based production builds produce 30-40% smaller bundles than alternatives
vite.why3: First-class TypeScript, JSX, and CSS support with zero configuration
vite.why4: Framework-agnostic with excellent React, Vue, and Svelte integration
vite.altWebpackDesc: Industry-standard module bundler with the largest ecosystem and extensive configuration
vite.altWebpackPros: Massive ecosystem, extensive loader system, proven at enterprise scale
vite.altWebpackCons: Slow dev server start, complex configuration, slower HMR at scale
vite.altParcelDesc: Zero-configuration build tool with automatic code splitting and transformation
vite.altParcelPros: True zero-config, automatic transformations, built-in dev server
vite.altParcelCons: Less control over output, smaller plugin ecosystem, less community support

tailwindcss.title: Tailwind CSS
tailwindcss.desc: Utility-first CSS framework for building custom designs rapidly without ever leaving your HTML, with built-in responsive design.
tailwindcss.longDesc:
Tailwind CSS fundamentally changed how we approach styling. Instead of writing custom CSS for every component, Tailwind provides low-level utility classes that compose into any design directly in your markup. The result is faster development, smaller CSS bundles, and designs that are trivially easy to maintain.

Every DMC Kreatif project uses Tailwind CSS with a custom design token system. Our colour palette, spacing scale, and typography are defined once in the Tailwind config, ensuring pixel-perfect consistency across every page. The JIT (Just-In-Time) compiler generates only the CSS you actually use, keeping bundles under 10KB.

For responsive design, Tailwind's mobile-first breakpoint system makes it effortless to create layouts that look stunning on every device. Combined with Tailwind's dark mode utilities and our neo-brutalist design system, we deliver unique, branded experiences that stand out from generic templates.
tailwindcss.why1: Utility-first approach reduces CSS bundle size by 80-95% compared to traditional frameworks
tailwindcss.why2: Custom design tokens ensure pixel-perfect brand consistency across all pages
tailwindcss.why3: Mobile-first responsive breakpoints make every site look perfect on every device
tailwindcss.why4: JIT compiler generates only used CSS, keeping production stylesheets under 10KB
tailwindcss.altBootstrapDesc: Popular component framework with pre-built UI elements and a grid system
tailwindcss.altBootstrapPros: Pre-built components, familiar grid system, extensive documentation
tailwindcss.altBootstrapCons: Generic look without heavy customisation, larger bundle, opinionated design
tailwindcss.altCssModulesDesc: Scoped CSS with automatic class name hashing for component-level encapsulation
tailwindcss.altCssModulesPros: True scope isolation, no naming conflicts, works with any CSS
tailwindcss.altCssModulesCons: Requires separate CSS files, no utility classes, more verbose styling

framer-motion.title: Framer Motion
framer-motion.desc: Production-ready React animation library with declarative syntax, gesture support, and layout animations.
framer-motion.longDesc:
Framer Motion is the most powerful animation library in the React ecosystem. It provides a declarative API that makes complex animations simple — from scroll-triggered reveals and page transitions to gesture-driven interactions and layout animations.

At DMC Kreatif, animations are not decorative — they communicate. Every scroll reveal, hover effect, and page transition is carefully orchestrated to guide users through the content hierarchy. Framer Motion's variants system lets us define animation states declaratively, keeping our code clean and maintainable.

The library's performance is exceptional. Framer Motion uses hardware-accelerated CSS transforms by default, animates at 60fps on mobile devices, and supports the Web Animations API for maximum efficiency. Its AnimatePresence component handles exit animations gracefully, something that's notoriously difficult with CSS alone.
framer-motion.why1: Declarative API makes complex animations simple to implement and maintain
framer-motion.why2: Hardware-accelerated transforms ensure 60fps animations even on mobile devices
framer-motion.why3: Variants system enables orchestrated, staggered animations with minimal code
framer-motion.why4: AnimatePresence handles exit animations that CSS alone cannot achieve

framer-motion.altGsapPros: Most powerful animation engine, timeline control, ScrollTrigger plugin
framer-motion.altGsapCons: Not React-native, imperative API, commercial licence for some features

framer-motion.altCssPros: Zero bundle cost, hardware accelerated, no JavaScript dependency
framer-motion.altCssCons: No exit animations, limited orchestration, cannot animate layout changes

supabase.title: Supabase
supabase.desc: Open-source Firebase alternative with PostgreSQL, real-time subscriptions, authentication, storage, and edge functions.
supabase.longDesc:
Supabase is our backend platform of choice. Built on top of PostgreSQL, it provides everything a modern web application needs: authentication, real-time subscriptions, file storage, edge functions, and a powerful auto-generated API — all without vendor lock-in.

For European businesses, Supabase offers a critical advantage: data can be hosted in EU regions, ensuring full GDPR compliance. Row-Level Security (RLS) policies let us implement fine-grained access control directly at the database level, meaning your data is protected even if application code has vulnerabilities.

Supabase's real-time capabilities enable features like live notifications, collaborative editing, and instant data synchronisation. Combined with its generous free tier and predictable pricing, Supabase is the ideal backend for startups and enterprises alike.
supabase.why1: PostgreSQL foundation ensures enterprise-grade reliability with zero vendor lock-in
supabase.why2: EU region hosting and Row-Level Security provide built-in GDPR compliance
supabase.why3: Real-time subscriptions enable live features without additional infrastructure
supabase.why4: Auto-generated REST and GraphQL APIs eliminate 80% of backend boilerplate

vercel.title: Vercel
vercel.desc: The platform for frontend developers, providing global edge deployment, serverless functions, and seamless Git integration.
vercel.longDesc:
Vercel is where our web applications live. As the creators of Next.js, Vercel provides the most optimised hosting platform for React and Next.js applications. Every deployment is distributed across their global edge network, ensuring sub-second load times from anywhere in Europe.

Our deployment workflow is fully automated: push to Git, and Vercel builds, tests, and deploys automatically. Every pull request gets its own preview URL for stakeholder review, and rollbacks are instant if anything goes wrong. This CI/CD pipeline means we can ship updates multiple times per day with zero risk.

Vercel's analytics provide real-time Core Web Vitals monitoring, so we can track performance metrics for every visitor. Combined with serverless functions for backend logic and edge middleware for authentication and redirects, Vercel is a complete platform — not just hosting.
vercel.why1: Global edge network delivers sub-second load times from 100+ points of presence
vercel.why2: Automatic CI/CD with preview deployments for every pull request
vercel.why3: Real-time Web Vitals analytics monitor performance for every visitor
vercel.why4: Created by the Next.js team, ensuring first-class framework support

shopify.title: Shopify
shopify.desc: The leading e-commerce platform for building online stores with multi-currency, multi-language, and EU payment support.
shopify.longDesc:
Shopify powers over 4 million online stores worldwide, and for good reason. It provides everything a European e-commerce business needs: multi-currency checkout, multi-language storefronts, EU payment gateway support, and GDPR-compliant data handling — all without managing servers.

At DMC Kreatif, we build custom Shopify experiences using both Liquid themes for traditional storefronts and Hydrogen (Shopify's React framework) for headless commerce. This means your store can have the reliability of Shopify's backend with a fully custom, blazing-fast frontend.

Shopify's app ecosystem of 8,000+ apps handles everything from inventory management and shipping to email marketing and loyalty programmes. Combined with Shopify Payments for seamless checkout across Europe, it's the fastest path to a profitable online store.
shopify.why1: Multi-currency and multi-language built-in for pan-European e-commerce
shopify.why2: 99.99% uptime with PCI DSS compliance eliminates server management overhead
shopify.why3: Hydrogen framework enables headless commerce with custom React frontends
shopify.why4: 8,000+ app ecosystem covers every e-commerce requirement imaginable

shopify.altWooPros: Open source, full customisation, huge plugin ecosystem, lower cost
